Detailed Description

Routines implementing music on hold.

  • See also Music on Hold Configuration
Author:
Mark Spencer <markster@digium.com>

01097    if (option_verbose > 1)
01098       ast_verbose(VERBOSE_PREFIX_2 "Destroying musiconhold processes\n");
01099 
01100    AST_RWLIST_WRLOCK(&mohclasses);
01101    while ((moh = AST_RWLIST_REMOVE_HEAD(&mohclasses, list))) {
01102       if (moh->pid > 1) {
01103          if (option_debug)
01104             ast_log(LOG_DEBUG, "killing %d!\n", moh->pid);
01105          stime = time(NULL) + 2;
01106          pid = moh->pid;
01107          moh->pid = 0;
01108          /* Back when this was just mpg123, SIGKILL was fine.  Now we need
01109           * to give the process a reason and time enough to kill off its
01110           * children. */
01111          kill(pid, SIGHUP);
01112          usleep(100000);
01113          kill(pid, SIGTERM);
01114          usleep(100000);
01115          kill(pid, SIGKILL);
01116          while ((ast_wait_for_input(moh->srcfd, 100) > 0) && (bytes = read(moh->srcfd, buff, 8192)) && time(NULL) < stime)
01117             tbytes = tbytes + bytes;
01118          if (option_debug)
01119             ast_log(LOG_DEBUG, "mpg123 pid %d and child died after %d bytes read\n", pid, tbytes);
01120          close(moh->srcfd);
01121       }
01122       ast_moh_free_class(&moh);
01123    }
01124    AST_RWLIST_UNLOCK(&mohclasses);
01125 }

Definition at line 952 of file res_musiconhold.c.

References ast_activate_generator(), AST_FLAG_MOH, ast_log(), AST_RWLIST_RDLOCK, AST_RWLIST_UNLOCK, ast_set_flag, ast_strlen_zero(), get_mohbyname(), LOG_WARNING, moh_file_stream, and mohclass::total_files.

Referenced by load_module(), moh_on_off(), and reload().

00953 {
00954    struct mohclass *mohclass;
00955    const char *class;
00956 
00957    /* The following is the order of preference for which class to use:
00958     * 1) The channels explicitly set musicclass, which should *only* be
00959     *    set by a call to Set(CHANNEL(musicclass)=whatever) in the dialplan.
00960     * 2) The mclass argument. If a channel is calling ast_moh_start() as the
00961     *    result of receiving a HOLD control frame, this should be the
00962     *    payload that came with the frame.
00963     * 3) The interpclass argument. This would be from the mohinterpret
00964     *    option from channel drivers. This is the same as the old musicclass
00965     *    option.
00966     * 4) The default class.
00967     */
00968    if (!ast_strlen_zero(chan->musicclass))
00969       class = chan->musicclass;
00970    else if (!ast_strlen_zero(mclass))
00971       class = mclass;
00972    else if (!ast_strlen_zero(interpclass))
00973       class = interpclass;
00974    else
00975       class = "default";
00976 
00977    AST_RWLIST_RDLOCK(&mohclasses);
00978    mohclass = get_mohbyname(class);
00979    AST_RWLIST_UNLOCK(&mohclasses);
00980 
00981    if (!mohclass) {
00982       ast_log(LOG_WARNING, "No class: %s\n", class);
00983       return -1;
00984    }
00985 
00986    ast_set_flag(chan, AST_FLAG_MOH);
00987    if (mohclass->total_files) {
00988       return ast_activate_generator(chan, &moh_file_stream, mohclass);
00989    } else
00990       return ast_activate_generator(chan, &mohgen, mohclass);
00991 }

00522    struct mohclass *class = data;
00523    struct mohdata *moh;
00524    char buf[8192];
00525    short sbuf[8192];
00526    int res, res2;
00527    int len;
00528    struct timeval tv, tv_tmp;
00529 
00530    tv.tv_sec = 0;
00531    tv.tv_usec = 0;
00532    for(;/* ever */;) {
00533       pthread_testcancel();
00534       /* Spawn mp3 player if it's not there */
00535       if (class->srcfd < 0) {
00536          if ((class->srcfd = spawn_mp3(class)) < 0) {
00537             ast_log(LOG_WARNING, "Unable to spawn mp3player\n");
00538             /* Try again later */
00539             sleep(500);
00540             pthread_testcancel();
00541          }
00542       }
00543       if (class->pseudofd > -1) {
00544 #ifdef SOLARIS
00545          thr_yield();
00546 #endif
00547          /* Pause some amount of time */
00548          res = read(class->pseudofd, buf, sizeof(buf));
00549          pthread_testcancel();
00550       } else {
00551          long delta;
00552          /* Reliable sleep */
00553          tv_tmp = ast_tvnow();
00554          if (ast_tvzero(tv))
00555             tv = tv_tmp;
00556          delta = ast_tvdiff_ms(tv_tmp, tv);
00557          if (delta < MOH_MS_INTERVAL) {   /* too early */
00558             tv = ast_tvadd(tv, ast_samp2tv(MOH_MS_INTERVAL, 1000));  /* next deadline */
00559             usleep(1000 * (MOH_MS_INTERVAL - delta));
00560             pthread_testcancel();
00561          } else {
00562             ast_log(LOG_NOTICE, "Request to schedule in the past?!?!\n");
00563             tv = tv_tmp;
00564          }
00565          res = 8 * MOH_MS_INTERVAL; /* 8 samples per millisecond */
00566       }
00567       if (AST_LIST_EMPTY(&class->members))
00568          continue;
00569       /* Read mp3 audio */
00570       len = ast_codec_get_len(class->format, res);
00571       
00572       if ((res2 = read(class->srcfd, sbuf, len)) != len) {
00573          if (!res2) {
00574             close(class->srcfd);
00575             class->srcfd = -1;
00576             pthread_testcancel();
00577             if (class->pid > 1) {
00578                kill(class->pid, SIGHUP);
00579                usleep(100000);
00580                kill(class->pid, SIGTERM);
00581                usleep(100000);
00582                kill(class->pid, SIGKILL);
00583                class->pid = 0;
00584             }
00585          } else {
00586             if (option_debug)
00587                ast_log(LOG_DEBUG, "Read %d bytes of audio while expecting %d\n", res2, len);
00588          }
00589          continue;
00590       }
00591       pthread_testcancel();
00592       AST_RWLIST_RDLOCK(&mohclasses);
00593       AST_RWLIST_TRAVERSE(&class->members, moh, list) {
00594          /* Write data */
00595          if ((res = write(moh->pipe[1], sbuf, res2)) != res2) {
00596             if (option_debug)
00597                ast_log(LOG_DEBUG, "Only wrote %d of %d bytes to pipe\n", res, res2);
00598          }
00599       }
00600       AST_RWLIST_UNLOCK(&mohclasses);
00601    }
00602    return NULL;
00603 }
